venue.name: Opposite to The Skating Club of Boston

item.description:
Hello Boston Volunteers,

 

We will be working in Herter park to fix up the grassy areas that were damaged by plows during the winter time snow-removal. We will work on patches raking the dirt, adding grass seed and loam. Please wear clothes that you can get dirty as we will be in close proximity to dirt and that is half the fun!

Please make sure to bring a bottle of water!


Location: Project will be held in Herter Park, see map for more details. Parking can be found in the large parking lot, and the volunteer activity will take place close-by.

See linked map for further details.
Google Maps link: http://goo.gl/maps/507gk


Directions: Volunteers can follow directions to meeting spot on linked Google Map. See linked map for further details.


Instructions on arrival: Please arrive by 9:00 a.m. for introductions and be prepared to beginwork after introductions. Also, please sign-in upon arrival.
Schedule for Work Period

Introduction: The River and Parklands & Description of Work: 9:00 a.m. – 12:00 p.m.

Work Period: 9:15 p.m. – 11:45 a.m

Clean-up / Summary / Evaluation: 11:45 a.m. – 12:00 p.m.

Please dress warm, bring water, wear glasses/sunglasses to protect your eyes. Work gloves and tools will be provided by Charles River Conservancy.

In case if you are lost, please contact..

Danielle Stehlik(716) 961-8183 Mobile phone for contact on day of event only

Thanks

Phani

Dont forget check out our new fundraising project for runners and dog lovers:

www.doggyfunrun.org
item.how_to_find_us: Charles Conservancy truck (see google maps link in details)

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: Charles River Conservancy-Fix grassy areas damaged by plows during the winter
